turns.content: Thank you. Now I will ask you to answer specific questions/points. Ok?
Sure, go ahead and ask your specific questions/points. I’m here to help!

Answer the following question with the information provided, add a brief description of each member (provided below)Individual or team summary\*Tell us about yourself, your experience, and your motivations. Feel free to link to any biography pages, LinkedIn pages, etc. Focus on the organization itself.

Based on the information provided, it seems that you are a multi-disciplinary team of Ethereum and Web3 enthusiasts from different cities in Mexico who are passionate about spreading knowledge and teaching people about blockchain technology and Ethereum values. You have been organizing virtual and in-person workshops, talks, Twitter Spaces, and events in different cities in Mexico, with a focus on onboarding more Mexican and Latin American people into Web3 and inspiring builders to create in Ethereum. Your team is supported by the Ethereum Foundation and consists of members with a range of experience and expertise in organizing events and working within the Ethereum ecosystem.
Unfortunately, there is no detailed information provided about the individual members of your team. If you would like to highlight the experience and expertise of your team in your proposal application, you may want to provide a brief description of each member’s background, skills, and contributions to the Ethereum Mexico community. This can help to instill confidence in the Ethereum Foundation that your team is capable of executing a successful conference. You can also link to any relevant biographical pages, LinkedIn profiles, or other online profiles to provide more information about your team members.

Write a concise paragraph presenting our organization, as if we were presenting ourselves with the following information:# 🧭 Misión\*\*Educar\*\* a más personas para aprender a utilizar la tecnología blockchain de manera segura mientras transmitimos los \*\*valores de Ethereum\*\* e \*\*inspiramos\*\* a las personas de México a \*\*construir en Web3\*\*. Siendo el \*\*puente\*\* entre el ecosistema de Ethereum, la Ethereum Foundation y otras comunidades en México.# 🔭 VisiónSomos uno de los puntos de acceso principales para las personas que quieran aprender sobre Web3/Ethereum y damos las herramientas para que las personas puedan participar y construir en Ethereum.Continuar con nuestra alianza en Ethereum Foundation y haber traído al menos 100 builders en Ethereum en 3 años (Developers) y 300 (Non tech).Ser una incubadora de comunidades de Ethereum México, en donde somos el puente entre el ecosistema de Ethereum, la Ethereum Foundation y otras comunidades en México para ayudar a la gestión, organización y promoción de eventos.Ser un medio confiable y cercano de difusión de contenido de Ethereum en Español de alta calidad en donde se encuentre el mejor contenido de Ethereum en español y apoyar a comunidades locales a aprender sobre Ethereum, dando las herramientas para que más personas de México puedan construir en Ethereum.# ⚖️ Valor que agregamosEl equipo de Ethereum México permite tener una entidad definida que provee apoyo y ayuda a las comunidades (y personas) locales dentro de todo el país; contribuyendo en la construcción de comunidades y nuevos proyectos relacionados a Ethereum.

We are Ethereum Mexico, a team of multi-disciplinary Ethereum and Web3 enthusiasts from different cities in Mexico who are passionate about educating people to use blockchain technology securely and inspiring them to build in Web3 while promoting the values of Ethereum. Our mission is to serve as the bridge between the Ethereum ecosystem, the Ethereum Foundation, and other communities in Mexico. Our vision is to be one of the main access points for people who want to learn about Web3/Ethereum and provide the tools for them to participate and build in Ethereum. We aim to be a reliable and trustworthy source of high-quality Ethereum content in Spanish and support local communities to learn about Ethereum by providing them with the tools to build in Ethereum. Our team adds value by providing support and assistance to local communities (and individuals) throughout the country, contributing to the construction of communities and new projects related to Ethereum.

Write a brief descripiton of only 300 characters of this proposal, in wording different from the used in the full explanation, make it clear and concise. We are hosting "Ethereum Mexico", an event in Mexico City on September 30th, with the goal of targeting an audience of 1200 people. The event will consist of talks and workshops that aim to educate attendees on web3, the current status of the ecosystem, and more complex topics such as future updates on Ethereum. We plan to offer all talks and workshops in Spanish, making it more accessible to people who want to learn from scratch about Ethereum. We aim to reach out to universities and smaller communities across Mexico to participate in the event, allowing us to expand our reach and connect with more people. Additionally, we will be launching a Quadratic Funding Round with the EF, which will help us to secure more funding for public goods in Mexico. Overall, the proposed work aligns with the EF’s mission and scope by focusing on community building, education, and strengthening the foundations of the Ethereum ecosystem.

“Ethereum Mexico” is a 1-day conference in Mexico City on September 30th, targeting an audience of 1200 people. We will offer talks and workshops in Spanish on web3 and the current state of the Ethereum ecosystem, including future updates. Our goal is to reach out to universities and smaller communities across Mexico, expanding our reach and connecting with more people. We will also launch a Quadratic Funding Round with the EF to secure more funding for public goods in Mexico. This proposal aligns with the EF’s mission by focusing on community building, education, and strengthening the foundations of the Ethereum ecosystem.

“Ethereum Mexico” is a 1-day conference in Mexico City on September 30th for 1200 attendees. Talks and workshops in Spanish will cover web3, the Ethereum ecosystem, and future updates. We’ll reach out to universities and communities across Mexico to expand our reach. A Quadratic Funding Round with the EF will secure more funding for public goods. Aligns with EF’s mission to strengthen Ethereum’s foundations, educate, and build communities.

Answer the following quesiton in a better way.Question: What problem(s) is being solved within the scope of the grant?\*Answer:We are creating an event for the Mexican people that can’t afford to go to other cities of the world to be part of an Ethereum event.We want to have an event where Mexican people learn that the web3 ecosystem is not only about crypto.This would be the first Ethereum México created and focused in a community-backed event.

To improve the answer to the question, “What problem(s) is being solved within the scope of the grant?” the following could be added:
Our grant proposal addresses several key problems within the scope of the grant. Firstly, we are addressing the issue of access and affordability for Mexican people who are interested in learning about the Ethereum ecosystem but cannot afford to attend events in other parts of the world. By hosting an event in Mexico City, we are providing a more accessible and affordable option for individuals who want to learn about Ethereum.
Secondly, we are tackling the problem of limited awareness and understanding of the web3 ecosystem in Mexico. Many people in Mexico still associate Ethereum with cryptocurrency and are not aware of its broader potential to transform industries beyond finance. By providing talks and workshops that cover a range of topics related to web3 and the Ethereum ecosystem, we aim to educate attendees and inspire them to build on Ethereum.
Lastly, we are aiming to create a community-backed event that is specifically focused on the Mexican Ethereum community. By bringing together builders, developers, and enthusiasts from across Mexico, we hope to foster collaboration, share knowledge, and build a stronger community that can continue to contribute to the growth and development of the Ethereum ecosystem in Mexico.
